Perform a Raw JSON-RPC Call to a NEAR Node

Source: R/utils.R
near_rpc.Rd

Internal function that powers every exported API call. Sends a properly formatted JSON-RPC 2.0 request and handles errors gracefully.

Usage

near_rpc(
  method,
  params = list(),
  timeout = getOption("nearjsonrpc.timeout", 30)
)

Arguments

method

Character scalar. The RPC method name (e.g., "query", "block", "status").

params

Named list of parameters (can be empty).

timeout

Maximum seconds to wait for a response (default: 30).

Value

A parsed R object (usually a list) from the JSON response.

Error handling

  • HTTP errors → rlang::abort() with status code

  • JSON-RPC errors → informative message from the node

  • Network timeouts → clear error
